oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Big Sound - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of a program to celebrate WSM winning the 1953-54 Variety Show Management Award as the Outstanding Music Station in the US. Personnel include Noel Digby (writer, producer), Bill McElhiney (arranger), Young Harper (arranger), Elmer Alley (engineer), and David Cobb (host). Includes performances by Webb Pierce, Marty Robbins, the Anita Kerr Singers, Buddy Hall, and the WSM Orchestra.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Webb Pierce; Marty Robbins; Anita Kerr Singers; WSM Orchestra; Buddy Hall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: David Cobb talks about WSM -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] -- David Cobb talks about country music -- David Cobb introduces Webb Pierce -- Webb Pierce talks -- Slowly (Webb Pierce) -- David Cobb introduces Marty Robbins -- Marty Robbins talks -- My Isle Of Golden Dreams (Marty Robbins) -- David Cobb talks about the music of WSM -- Not Mine (The Anita Kerr Singers) -- David Cobb introduces Buddy Hall -- Stranger In Paradise (Buddy Hall) -- David Cobb talks about WSM winning the Variety award -- Theme -- David Cobb reads the credits
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Big sound (Radio program); Cobb, David (Announcer); McElhiney, Bill; Digby, Noel; Harper, Young; Alley, Elmer; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hall, Buddy (Singer); Anita Kerr Singers; Pierce, Webb, 1921-1991; Robbins, Marty; Bradley, Owen; WSM Orchestra
